entry.title: FREEZING RAIN WARNING, Hearst
entry.summary: Persons in or near this area should be on the lookout for adverse weather conditions and take necessary safety precautions. Issued: 10:58 p.m. EDT Tuesday 4 April 2023

entry.title: Tuesday night: Periods of light snow. Low minus 12. POP 40%
entry.summary: Increasing cloudiness. 40 percent chance of light snow late this evening and overnight. Periods of snow beginning before morning. Wind east 30 km/h gusting to 50. Low minus 12. Wind chill minus 11 this evening and minus 21 overnight. Forecast issued 5:12 PM EDT Tuesday 4 April 2023

entry.title: Wednesday: Ice pellets mixed with snow. High minus 3.
entry.summary: Periods of snow changing to ice pellets or periods of snow late in the morning. Risk of freezing rain late in the afternoon. Snow and ice pellet amount 5 cm. Wind becoming east 30 km/h gusting to 60 late in the morning. High minus 3. Wind chill minus 18 in the morning and minus 10 in the afternoon. UV index 2 or low. Forecast issued 5:12 PM EDT Tuesday 4 April 2023

entry.title: Wednesday night: Chance of flurries. Temperature rising to zero by morning. POP 40%
entry.summary: Ice pellets or periods of snow changing to periods of freezing rain mixed with ice pellets and ending near midnight then cloudy with 40 percent chance of flurries. Risk of freezing rain in the evening and overnight. Wind southeast 30 km/h gusting to 60 becoming southwest 40 gusting to 70 after midnight. Temperature rising to zero by morning. Wind chill minus 11 in the evening. Forecast issued 5:12 PM EDT Tuesday 4 April 2023
